text: Private insurance companies cheat taxpayers through Medicare Advantage plans, and deprive older Americans of the care they need. I led colleagues to reintroduce legislation to improve transparency and give watchdogs the data they need to hold these insurers accountable.

 1. Snatch up small, innovative biotech firms

The #InflationReductionAct is a big win, but only if people can actually get the help this landmark law offers. A year since we passed the IRA, the tax credits still aren‚Äôt available to Americans. Our climate‚Äîand families‚Äîcan‚Äôt afford to wait.

Private insurers want to infect Medicare with corporate greed to boost their profits, and I won't stand for it. I‚Äôm proud to lead the effort in Congress to protect Traditional Medicare, alongside tireless advocates like @morethanmySLE.

Big Oil was cheating all Americans by drilling on public lands for pennies on the acre. The #InflationReductionAct included my bill to charge polluters more to lease federal land‚Äîthe first increase in over 100 years. It‚Äôs already saving taxpayers millions.

For years, Big Pharma lined their pockets by jacking prices way higher than inflation. My law recovers tax dollars from drug companies that rip off Americans. Patients are already paying less, and the program will recoup $63 billion over 10 years.

Today we‚Äôre celebrating one year of the #InflationReductionAct, an historic investment to fight climate change and lower costs for Americans. Two of my proposals that take on Big Pharma and Big Oil were signed into law as part of the IRA‚Äîand we‚Äôre already seeing the returns.

Congress needs to step up to take care of our planet; I hear it from my kids every day, and last week I heard it from Orange County families at my town hall. Investing in clean energy and climate resiliency isn‚Äôt just smart environmental policy‚Äîit‚Äôs good for our economy, too.

I will not be silent as Congress moves in the wrong direction on Pentagon oversight. I‚Äôve now introduced those anti-corruption amendments as standalone bills, to keep up the pressure for cracking down on special interest influence. porter.house.gov/news/docume‚Ä¶

For this year‚Äôs defense bill, I reintroduced anti-corruption amendments on Pentagon officials trading Big Defense stock and lobbying after they leave public service. These passed the House with bipartisan support in the past, but now, Republicans won't even let them get voted on.

It's outrageous that Big Oil and Wall Street want to profit off our public lands AND leave us with the bill for cleanup. New regulations, based on my legislation, will require more money from polluters up front and secure more in royalties from drilling. Enough is enough.

There's too little Congressional oversight and too much taxpayer money padding the pockets of Big Defense. I will not stop calling out corporate abuse from companies like TransDigm, and I hope more of my colleagues do the right thing for taxpayers.

I recently joined @POTUS as he announced new steps to implement my law to finally bring parity to mental health coverage. Until every insurer treats mental health the same as physical health‚Äîand every American gets the care they need‚Äîwe cannot let up on oversight and enforcement.

The #VotingRightsAct became law 58 years ago today, and for decades, it helped protect Americans from discrimination in accessing the ballot box. An extremist Supreme Court gutted its safeguards. We must restore and strengthen the VRA to protect our democracy.

The Nuclear Test Ban Treaty showcased the power of diplomacy to keep our world safe for future generations. It‚Äôs been 60 years since we signed the treaty, but the U.S. still hasn‚Äôt formally apologized for our nuclear legacy in the Marshall Islands. I‚Äôm working to fix that.

Congress should have our servicemembers‚Äô backs when they return home. I proudly voted for the PACT Act to improve health care and support for veterans exposed to toxic substances during their service. Apply by August 9 for backdated benefits: VA.gov/PACT

California‚Äôs farmers contribute tens of billions to our economy producing much of our country‚Äôs fruits, vegetables, and nuts. As Congress begins to consider the Farm Bill, I stopped by some farms and orchards in Bakersfield to hear how we can support our agricultural industry.

Play stupid games; win stupid prizes. As I warned earlier this year, Republicans‚Äô insistence on taking our economy hostage could cause long-term financial harm‚Äîincluding a hit to our credit rating. We should abolish the debt ceiling and stop the opportunity for brinksmanship.

For 58 years, Medicare has helped secure Americans' health care, but increasingly, private insurers have encroached on this foundational program. Medicare Advantage has cheated patients and taxpayers, threatening Medicare‚Äôs future. I‚Äôm working to crack down on this abuse.

Whistleblowers work hand-in-hand with Congress to root out waste, fraud, and abuse. I‚Äôm reintroducing a resolution to honor these important oversight partners and declare July 30th ‚ÄúNational Whistleblower Appreciation Day.‚Äù

As @Teamsters know, our entire economy benefits when workers receive fair wages and have safe working conditions. In Washington, I'll keep working to stand up to corporate abuse and to protect Americans' right to organize.

You pollute, you pay.

This week, the House is voting on a comprehensive air travel bill. Republicans blocked even having a vote on my amendment to get flyers prompt rebooking or refunds when there are controllable delays or cancellations‚Äîdespite, as @RepMcGovern notes, this being popular policy.

One in four California child care centers has dangerously high levels of lead in drinking water, threatening our children‚Äôs health. The Bipartisan Infrastructure Law will help replace lead pipes across the country, an important step to keep our kids safe.

Living up to our nation‚Äôs core values means treating everyone here with dignity and respect. I convened a roundtable with @USCIS and local immigrant support organizations to hear updates and discuss how the federal government can be a better partner.

I applaud @POTUS‚Äô leadership on this issue. Reining in Big Insurance‚Äôs corporate abuse lowers costs and strengthens care. That‚Äôs why I‚Äôve worked on legislation to shield new parents from surprise bills and protect patients from the long-term harms of medical debt.

My friend @RepLisaMcClain and I are holding those responsible for last year‚Äôs crisis accountable. Today‚Äôs decision was a win for families, but we aren‚Äôt done working to protect our nation‚Äôs infants. washingtonpost.com/business/‚Ä¶

It's been one year since #Dobbs, and I'm continuing to fight like hell to restore Americans‚Äô freedom to choose if and when to have a family.
